unnormalised: Someone asked me about where to send an RTI application for information about a specific govt. scheme. It got me thinking about how complicated it can be to find the right address sometimes.
normalised: Someone asked me about where to send an R-T-I application for information about a specific government scheme. It got me thinking about how complicated it can be to find the right address sometimes.

unnormalised: I remember once trying to find the address for the Ministry of Rural Development for a project I was working on. I spent ages searching online! I finally found something that looked promising: Krishi Bhavan, Dr. Rajendra Prasad Road, New Delhi, 110001. Sent my application there, waited weeks, and then got a response saying it was the wrong department! Turns out, the relevant department was located at a completely different building.

I finally found something that looked promising: Krishi Bhavan, Doctor Rajendra Prasad Road, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and one. Sent my application there, waited weeks, and then got a response saying it was the wrong department! Turns out, the relevant department was located at a completely different building.

unnormalised: Then, I needed to find the address for the regional office of the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) in Mumbai. I thought, "This will be easy, just google it!" But no, the website listed like 5 different addresses in different parts of Mumbai! Finally called their helpline (which took another 20 mins to get through!), and they told me to send it to: Regional Office, EPFO, Bandra (East), Mumbai – 400051.
normalised: Then, I needed to find the address for the regional office of the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (E-P-F-O) in Mumbai. I thought, "This will be easy, just google it!" But no, the website listed like five different addresses in different parts of Mumbai! Finally called their helpline (which took another twenty minutes to get through!), and they told me to send it to: Regional Office, E-P-F-O, Bandra (East), Mumbai – four hundred thousand and fifty one.

unnormalised: So, yeah, just a word of caution: even if you find an address online, double-check its validity. Try calling the relevant department or using official government directories if possible. Otherwise, you might end up wasting time and postage like I did!
